alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 9:51PM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Minnesota... Mississippi River at Winona affecting Winona, Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. .Warm temperatures this week have melted much of the regional snowpack. This snowmelt is routing into the Mississippi River. Rain this weekend is expected to further increase river flows. This additional rainfall and upstream inflow has increased the expected crest at Winona between 17 to 18.5 feet around April 21st to 22nd. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Winona. * WHEN...From Sunday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Some railroad lines may become inoperative. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Sunday morning and continue rising to 18.3 feet Friday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.3 feet on 04/11/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM CDT.
